vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀλληγορ-έω,
(ἀγορεύω) interpret allegorically, Ἕλληνες Κρόνον ἀλληγοροῦσι τὸν χρόνον[Refs 1st c.AD+]:—passive, to be spoken allegorically, [NT]; ἀλληγορεῖται ἁ Ἀπόλλων εἰς τὸν Ἥλιον, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 absolutely, speak figuratively or metaphorically, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; speak allegorically, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to take figuratively, speak allegorically, to employ an analogy or likeness in communication
vocabInfos.mediumDef: to say what is either designed, or fitted to convey a meaning other than the literal one, to take figuratively, to allegorize; ἀλληγορούμενος, adapted to another meaning, otherwise significant, Gal. 4:24*
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition: 寓意表達, 用比喻說話 (加 4:24)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition: 寓意表达, 用比喻说话 (加 4:24)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: nói bằng dụ ngôn; ngụ ngôn; ngụ ý; sử dụng một nghĩa bóng
